parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To call together. From sun and kaleo; to convoke.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.
A neighbor. From ge; a neighbour; by implication, a friend.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: To rejoice with, congratulate. From sun and chairo; to sympathize in gladness, congratulate.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary heuro, which heureo is used for it in all the tenses except the present and imperfect to find.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: From apo and the base of olethros; to destroy fully, literally or figuratively.
A drachma, a Greek silver coin. From drassomai; a drachma or coin.
